channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report I-2024100089
item.description:
Report I-2024100089

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 2000 a group arrived with 2 different airway bills linked to a single PAL accounting when we inquired if any of the shipments contained Dangerous Goods they assured us they were only shipping clothing and a couple of cell phones. We explained that cellphones are considered dangerous goods due to the lithium-ion batteries inside. The customer demanded that we load it on the flight because they are okay. When we refused to do so they stated they would take the cellphones out. However during the screening process the screener noticed cellphones and 2 tablet found the cellphones were wrapped in writing paper. The charging cord was wrapped around the phone. I ultimately decided to refuse the shipment due to the undeclared dangerous goods and the way they were ____ .

  • Description: RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE LOAD WALL, UPON ARRIVAL IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE. PLACED PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY TO TRANSPORT TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024101770
item.description:
Report X-2024101770

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RECEIVED A CALL FOR THE UNLOAD WALL FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. UPON ARRIVAL IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE. CLEANED UP ALL CONTAMINATED DEBRIS AND LEAKED OUT PRODUCT. PLACED ALL IN-SPILL TRAY ALONG WITH LEAKING PACKAGE. TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR PORPER DISPOSAL.
